definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: Usually, switching to the mid-grade or premium-grade gasoline will remove the knock.
sentences.chinese: 通常，切换到中等或以超值的汽油会删除敲。

sentences.english: It was certainly the best 40p worth of entertainment I have had in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 这是我很久以来花40便士买到的最超值的娱乐。

sentences.english: Small two-door cars are a big value not just in price, but safety as well.
sentences.chinese: 小型双门车不仅在价格上，在安全系数上也很超值。

sentences.english: Let each time an enjoy over-valued service for customer.
sentences.chinese: 让每一为客户享受到超值的服务。

sentences.english: Already the very ultra value pocket, thanked comments, feels relieved with.
sentences.chinese: 已经很超值的包包啦，谢谢回评，放心用吧。

sentences.english: BPlease give me this extra value meal, a red bean pie, and one order of vegetable salad.
sentences.chinese: 请给我这个超值套餐，一个红豆派和一份蔬菜沙拉。

sentences.english: For example, Bed, Bath &Beyond has a clearance section where you can find all kinds of wonderful household items for a fraction of the original cost.
sentences.chinese: 例如，你可以在清仓甩卖点看到各类超值的卫浴寝具。

sentences.english: You may receive a premium discount package of Hong Kong tour.
sentences.chinese: 你可以享受到香港游超值优惠套餐。

sentences.english: The company has been looking for the world better and more value-added red wine as own duty.
sentences.chinese: 本公司一直以寻找世界更好，更超值的红酒为己任。

definition: to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
